task.title: Quick start
task.shortdesc: This document shows how to install and start Open Search Server.

taskbody.prereq:
Open Search Server (OSS) requires a Java™ runtime environment (JRE) version 5 or newer.
Sun Microsystems provides JRE (or JDK) for Windows™ , Linux and Solaris™ operating systems: Sun download page .
IBM® provides JRE for AIX™, and Linux operating systems: IBM developer kits
taskbody.context: OSS runs on following operating system: Windows XP/2000/VISTA™ , Linux, Max OS X 10.4™, Solaris™ 8 and newer, Open Solaris.

step.cmd: Download the appropriate package file for your environment.
step.info: Packages are available in zip and tar.gz format. They can be downloaded here: SourceForge OSS download page .

step.cmd: Uncompress and/or unarchive the package file.
step.stepresult: You get a new folder named "open-search-server".

step.cmd: Start the server by executing the start file.

choices.choice: On Windows, run the file start.bat as a command.
On Unix/Linux/Mac OS, open a shell, and execute start.sh.

step.stepresult: The server is running, listening on the tcp port 8080.

step.cmd: Open an Internet navigator (Internet Explorer, Firefox/Mozilla, Safari), an enter an url that can reach your server.

choices.choice: If the server runs on your desktop machine, you can use: http://localhost:8080
If OSS runs on a remote server, you should build the appropriate URL, like this: http://[server-hostname]:8080

step.cmd: You must provide a path to the directory where you want to store the index data. We recommend you to start with the web_crawler folder provided in the examples folder.

choices.choice: On Unix/Linux/Mac systems, enter the absolute path. Eg.: /home/me/open-search-server/examples/web_crawler

On Windows systems, enter a Windows UNC pathname like that:
\\ComputerName\SomeFolder\open-search-server\examples\web_crawler

step.stepresult: You are on the start page of the admin interface. All tab panel are now be visible.

step.cmd: Enter the url of the web site you want to crawl.

substep.cmd: Select the Crawler panel, then the Web sub panel, and finally the Pattern list sub panel

Enter http://www.open-search-server.com*
and click on the Add button.
Select the Crawl process sub panel.
Click on the Not running - Click to start button.

step.stepresult: Open Search Server crawl the web site.

substep.cmd: Load the already predefined search query template
Enter a word in the field named Enter the query . Eg.: open

step.cmd: Try the same request using the XML API. Open a new navigator with the following url: http://localhost:8080/select?qt=search&q=open
step.stepresult: The open search result in XML format.
